p: In a study of Ai et al. results, shown in Table 1 , demonstrated the high sensitivity of CT scan as a conventional, rapid and practical diagnostic method in screening and managing critical cases in epidemic areas. Also, 42% of cases eventually improved in follow-up scans before the turning of rRT-PCR results in negative, which recommends the use of a CT scan in the follow-up. However, the study revealed many limitations, including the low specificity due to the false-positive cases with the common imaging characteristics with other viral pneumonia [ 25].
